item.title: Bayes Theorem as peices of cake
item.description: Under construction - I’m not Bayes theorem is that theorem on conditional probability. \(P(A|B) = \frac{P(B|A)*P(A)}{P(B)} = \frac{Union(A B)}{P(B)}\) It is simple and elegant. Like a piece of cake.
